abstract: A federal judge dismissed a lawsuit brought by Bank of America against two former Bear Stearns executives that accused the two men of lying about the health of their hedge funds, which had invested heavily in subprime mortgages.
snippet: A federal judge dismissed a lawsuit brought by Bank of America against two former Bear Stearns executives that accused the two men of lying about the health of their hedge funds, which had invested heavily in subprime mortgages.
lead_paragraph: Ralph R. Cioffi and Matthew M. Tannin, two former Bear Stearns managers who were among the few executives to face a trial on criminal charges in the aftermath of the financial crisis, have won another legal victory.

headline.main: Bank of America Suit Against Two Ex-Bear Stearns Executives Is Dismissed

abstract: Verizon’s deal, which included $61 billion in financing, highlights what bankers describe as the continued health of the debt markets.
snippet: Verizon’s deal, which included $61 billion in financing, highlights what bankers describe as the continued health of the debt markets.
lead_paragraph: Verizon Communications’ blockbuster deal to take full control of its wireless unit may seem dauntingly large. But for the two banks leading the arrangement of its $61 billion financing, it’s possible to pull off.

headline.main: Verizon’s Deal Financing Moves Quickly, as Debt Markets Remain Open

byline.original: By Michael J. de la Merced
